clinical_study.brief_title: FRIENDS as a Prevention Program in Schools in Norway
clinical_study.official_title: The FRIENDS-program as Universal and Indicative Prevention for Children and Adolescents With Symptoms of Anxiety and Depression

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this pilot-study is to evaluate a cognitive behavioral program, the Friends-program, as indicated prevention for anxious youth with or without symptoms of depression. The youth are recruited by school nurses who will also lead the intervention groups applying the Friends-manual developed by Paula Barrett. The study will furthermore also evaluate the Friends program as an universal prevention program used in ordinary school classes with school nurses and class-room teachers as Friends-leaders.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Non-Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Prevention

primary_outcome.measure: Change in anxiety symptoms from baseline to 12 months after completing the FRIENDS program, measured by the Spence Children Anxiety Scale (SCAS)
primary_outcome.time_frame: When completing the intervention and 3months and 12 months after having completed the intervention

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in life-quality (measured by KINDL)from baseline to 12 months after completing the FRIENDS program
secondary_outcome.time_frame: When completing the intervention and 3months and 12 months after having completed the intervention

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in depressive symptoms (measured by SMFQ -the Short Mood and Feeling questionnaire)from baseline to 12 months after completing the FRIENDS program
secondary_outcome.time_frame: When completing the intervention and 3months and 12 months after having completed the intervention

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in psychosocial functioning (measured by the SDQ- Strengths and difficulties questionnaire)from baseline until 12 months after having completed the FRIENDS program
secondary_outcome.time_frame: When completing the intervention and 3months and 12 months after having completed the intervention

arm_group.arm_group_label: The Friends program as indicative prevention interventions
arm_group.description: In this groups youth with increased levels of anxiety (and depression) are thought to regulate their fear by recognizing bodily cues, learning relaxation, regulating thoughts and feelings and expose themselves to situations and objects that activate their anxiety. The Friends-program is a ten weeks group interventions based on principles from Cognitive Behavioural Therapy aimed at ameliorating symptoms of anxiety and depression in children and adolescents. There are age-specific versions of the manual, one for children 8-12 years and one for adolescents 12-15 years.

arm_group.arm_group_label: The Friends-program as universal prevention in school classes
arm_group.description: The Friends-program is here used with all children in 5 school classes, to increase their problem solving skills, to identify feelings and thoughts and to foster a positive class-climate

The Friends-program as universal prevention in school classes

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- subclinical to clinical symptoms of anxiety with or without comorbid symptoms of depression
Exclusion Criteria:
- previously diagnosed with conduct disorder, major life-crises that needs to be attended to, serious school refusal, OCD, mental retardation or autism.
